stem: A client is 24 hours post-total thyroidectomy. Based on the documentation in the Post-Surgical Parathyroid & Neuro Stability Log, which finding requires the most immediate intervention?

tabs.title: Neuromuscular Exam
tabs.content: Current: Client reports 'tingling' around the mouth (circumoral paresthesia). When the BP cuff is inflated to 20 mmHg above systolic pressure, the client's hand develops a **carpal spasm** (flexion of the wrist and adduction of the thumb).

tabs.title: Metabolic Trends
tabs.content:
TestAdmissionNow (Post-Op)
Total Calcium9.2 mg/dL6.4 mg/dL (Low)
Albumin4.0 g/dL3.8 g/dL
Magnesium2.0 mg/dL1.9 mg/dL

options.text: Administer IV Calcium Gluconate and initiate seizure precautions
Assess the back of the neck for post-operative hematoma
Encourage the client to eat high-dairy snacks
Notify the physician of the 'Trousseau sign' and wait for repeat labs

rationale.correct: This is **Hypocalcemia (a1)**, likely caused by accidental damage or removal of the parathyroid glands during the thyroidectomy. The **Trousseau sign** (carpal spasm with BP cuff inflation) and the circumoral paresthesia are classic indicators of neuromuscular irritability. Because the Calcium is critically low (6.4), the patient is at extremely high risk for **laryngospasm** (airway closure) and seizures. **IV Calcium Gluconate (a1)** is the mandatory treatment.
clinicalPearls: Trousseau Sign = Carpal Spasm. Chvostek Sign = Cheek twitch.
CAT-S of Hypocalcemia: Convulsions, Arrhythmias, Tetany, Spasms (and Stridor).
Keep a tracheostomy tray and Calcium Gluconate at the bedside after thyroid surgery.

questionTrap.trap: Choosing to check the neck first (a2).
questionTrap.howToOvercome: While airway assessment is vital, the specific **Trousseau sign** indicates a metabolic catastrophe. Checking the neck for blood won't fix the carpal spasms and upcoming seizures. Fix the calcium.

mnemonic.title: Wait for T
mnemonic.expansion: T-Thyroid surgery. T-Tingling. T-Trousseau. T-Treatment is Calcium.
